trans-unit.source: Provides the Web site from which a code assembly originates as evidence for policy evaluation.
This class cannot be inherited.
The presence of <xref:System.Security.Policy.Site> evidence produces a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SiteIdentityPermission> in the grant set.

If there is a <xref:System.Security.CodeAccessPermission.Demand%2A> for <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SiteIdentityPermission>, the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SiteIdentityPermission> that corresponds to the <xref:System.Security.Policy.Site> evidence will be compared with the demanded permission.
Site identity is defined for code from URLs with any protocol except FILE.
A site is the string between the "//" after the protocol of a URL and the following "/", if present.
For example, www.fourthcoffee.com is the site identity in the URL http://www.fourthcoffee.com/process/grind.htm.
This excludes port numbers.
If a given URL is http://www.fourthcoffee.com:8000/, the site is www.fourthcoffee.com, not www.fourthcoffee.com:8000.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Site"></xref> class with the website from which a code assembly originates.
The website of origin for the associated code assembly.
The name parameter is `null`.
Creates a new object that is a copy of the current instance.
A new object that is a copy of this instance.
Creates an equivalent copy of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Site"></xref> object.
A new object that is identical to the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Site"></xref> object.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Site"></xref> object from the specified URL.
The URL from which to create the new <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Site"></xref> object.
A new site object.
The url parameter is not a valid URL.
-or-
The url parameter is a file name.
Creates an identity permission that corresponds to the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Site"></xref> object.
The evidence from which to construct the identity permission.
A site identity permission for the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Site"></xref> object.
Compares the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Site"></xref> to the specified object for equivalence.
<xref:System.Security.Policy.Site> objects are equal if they designate the same website name.
The object to test for equivalence with the current object.
`true` if the two instances of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Site"></xref> class are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the hash code of the current website name.
The hash code of the current website name.
Gets the website from which the code assembly originates.
The name of the website from which the code assembly originates.
Returns a string representation of the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Site"></xref> object.
A representation of the current site.
